seo.title: Nano Banana – Photoreal Image Generation | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate photoreal stills and edits with Nano Banana. Text-to-image and image-to-image for keyframes, thumbnails, and references before you animate in Sora, Veo, or Kling.

overview: Nano Banana is your photoreal image sidekick in MaxVideoAI. Lock style, lighting, and framing before you render video—text-to-image plus image edits from the same wallet and prompt lab.

hero.title: Nano Banana – Photoreal Image Generation
hero.intro: Fast still generation and edits from natural language — built for quick creative exploration.

items.title: Thumbnails, headlines, and basic layout text

technicalOverview.label: Input types
technicalOverview.body: Text prompts, reference images (JPG/PNG/WebP), and edit mode for restyles or cleanups.

technicalOverview.label: Outputs
technicalOverview.body: High-res still images tuned for photorealism and text legibility.

technicalOverview.label: Modes
technicalOverview.body: Text-to-image; image-to-image for restyle, cleanup, and background replacement.

technicalOverview.label: Typical use
technicalOverview.body: Prepare 1–4 keyframes before animating in Sora, Veo, Kling, or Wan.

promptStructure.title: Prompt mini-guide
promptStructure.description: Keep prompts descriptive and grounded. Mention subject, setting, lens, lighting, and how you’ll use the frame.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Generate 2–4 keyframes, then animate them in Veo/Sora/Kling.
Use edit mode to clean dust, even lighting, or replace backgrounds.
Lock seeds for consistency across a series.

prompts.title: Product hero (text → image)
prompts.prompt: Photoreal studio product shot of a wireless earbud on a dark glossy surface, soft rim light, minimal background, 8K, product photography.

prompts.title: Lifestyle keyframe (text → image)
prompts.prompt: Warm lifestyle scene of a young professional working on a laptop by a big window at golden hour, soft bokeh city lights outside, realistic colours, cinema-grade lighting.

prompts.title: Cleanup (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Clean up this product mockup: even out the lighting, remove dust and fingerprints, and place it on a soft gradient background suitable for e-commerce.

prompts.title: Magazine restyle (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Using this portrait photo, match the look of a glossy magazine cover: smoother skin, slightly punchier contrast, subtle colour grading and a neutral studio backdrop.

faqs.q: Is Nano Banana for images or video?
faqs.a: Images. Use it for photoreal references, thumbnails, and keyframes before sending shots to video engines.
Generate multiple outputs per run (controlled by "num images" / num_images). Keep batches small for faster iteration.
No. Upload one or more images and describe the edit in plain language (what to change, what to keep).

pricingNotes: Live pricing updates inside the workspace. Check the chip before you render.

custom.heroSupportLine: Best for rapid concepting, lightweight campaign visuals, and clean reference boards before video.
custom.heroDesc1: Generate photoreal stills and edits to lock style, lighting, and framing before you animate in Sora, Veo, or Kling.
custom.heroDesc2: Text-to-image and image-to-image share the same wallet and prompt lab as your video engines, with 1–8 outputs per run.
heroHighlights: Speed-first workflow||Built to iterate fast when you need lots of options quickly.
Edits without heavy tooling||Describe the change in plain English; keep the rest consistent.
Multi-image creativity||Blend references to stay closer to your intent across variants.
Great “draft layer” for production||Generate boards, then hand off winners to high-end video engines.

bestUseCases.title: Thumbnails, headlines, and basic layout text

custom.whatTitle: How Nano Banana works in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Choose text-to-image or image-to-image, set the batch size (1–8), write your prompt or edit instructions, and generate.
custom.whatIntro2: Use it to lock style, lighting, and framing before animating in video engines.
whatFlowSteps: Open the Image lab with Nano Banana selected
Pick Text → Image or Image → Image
Set num_images (1–8) and seed if you need consistency
Add your prompt; for edits, upload a clean reference
Check the live price chip and generate
custom.galleryIntro: Recent photoreal stills and edits used as keyframes for video workflows.
custom.tipsIntro: Image generation is most predictable when you keep the frame simple, readable, and physically grounded.
strengths: Fast photoreal stills for moodboards, thumbnails, and keyframes
Edit mode for cleanup, relight, and background swaps (no masking)
Multi-image blends when you assign roles to references
boundaries: Edits require an input image (upload at least one reference)
Small on-screen text is hit-or-miss — overlay critical copy in post
safetyRules: No sexual content, and nothing involving minors.
No hateful, harassing, or graphic-violence content.
Don’t impersonate real people or public figures; use consent for any likeness.
Don’t include private personal data (faces of non-consenting people, addresses, phone numbers, documents).
Some prompts or reference images may be blocked by provider safety filters.
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Nano Banana Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image) rewards short, literal briefs. Lead with composition, then lighting/style. For edits, say what to change and what must stay the same. For multi-image blends, assign each reference a role.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: resolution + aspect ratio are set in the UI — your prompt controls subject, composition, lighting, style, and edit instructions.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Keep prompts short and specific; avoid long wish-lists.
For edits: "Change X, keep Y" beats re-describing the whole scene.
If text matters: keep it short, high-contrast, and quote it exactly.
promptingEngineWhy: Fast tier favors short prompts; long prompts can wander.
Multi-image works best when each image has a clear role (subject vs lighting vs background).
Tiny text and dense UI are unreliable — keep copy minimal and overlay critical text in post.
If an edit over-changes the image, tighten the "keep" list (framing, lighting, identity).

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = repeatability. Use for controlled batches.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
[Subject] in [setting]. [Composition]. [Lighting]. [Style anchor].

If editing:
Edit: change [X]. Keep [Y] (framing, lighting, identity).

If using multiple images:
Refs: Image1 = [main subject]. Image2 = [style/lighting]. (Optional) Image3 = [background/prop].

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + 2–3 defining details.]

Composition:
[Framing + angle + background + what stays clean.]

Lighting:
[Key light + mood + 2 palette anchors.]

Style:
[Photoreal / illustration + texture/grain + one style reference.]

Text (optional):
[Exact copy in quotes + placement + contrast.]
Example: “SALE — 20% OFF” top-left, one line, high contrast.

Edit (if editing):
Change:
- [list the changes]
Keep:
- framing, lighting, identity, logo-free, clean background

References (if using multiple images):
Image1 controls subject/identity
Image2 controls lighting
Image3 controls palette/background

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or repeatable results across a set.
promptingTabs.copy:
Brief:
[Goal + output use case.]

Subject + materials:
[Details + textures + constraints.]

Layout:
[Grid + spacing + focal point + negative space.]

Lighting + grade:
[Key light + contrast + palette anchors.]

Typography (optional):
[Font vibe + hierarchy + exact copy + placement.]
Keep copy short. Avoid paragraphs.

Edits (if needed):
Change list:
- [A]
- [B]
Keep list:
- framing, lighting, identity, background, color palette
